Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: MDWfan1
Reviews.Content: My wife and cousin and I just spent a week with these folks on the recommendation of my daughter, who’s lived and studied in Rome for several years. Not surprised to see the extraordinary number of “excellent” reviews, as we agree completely. Can’t imagine a more gracious and accommodating staff. They even winked conspiratorially at my daughter as she joined us for the breakfast: it was too good; she couldn’t resist. After “perfect,” what can anyone say about the location? I suppose you could sleep right there in the Piazza San Pietro (if they’d let you) but failing that it would be hard to get closer to the Vatican. No vehicles allowed on Borgo Pio is a wonderful bonus. Everything you need is just steps away: fruit and produce shop, bakery, deli, wine store, pharmacy, excellent gelato (careful though, or they’ll overcharge), and delightful dining all right on the block or one up or down. The Vatican Museum is 8-10 minute walk; St. Peter’s is five. Buses three short blocks away will take you anywhere else you might want to visit, although we walked everywhere: trips to the Pantheon, the Coliseum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps--to name a few--gave us the chance to see Rome as the Romans do. Well okay, they aren’t doing as much gawking. After three days this was my neighborhood. Seriously, it felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terwell
Reviews.Content: When we first booked this hotel I was somewhat concerned of the location because it was right around the corner from the Vatican and thought that it would be far away from restaurants and sights. This hotel was perfect in everyway. The location was great. There were at least 10 restaurants within a block of the hotel with at least 5 right on the same street. There were shops, cafes and the best pastry. The hotel was very clean, welcoming and the rooms were very affordable. We took the city bus to all the major sights and later we took the metro train over to the spanish steps and trevi fountain. I would highly recommend this hotel for a perfect stop in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DollyGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sant Anna is a real jewel! Beautifully furnished, very clean, quiet and the buffet breakfast is exceptional! The staff was very friendly, especially Andrea who did his best to advise us with sightseeing and to help us with the booking of our plane tickets, he was a delight to talk to. The hotel is only a few steps away from the Vatican. We stayed 5 nights and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky find !”
Reviews.Author: stanislas_11
Reviews.Content: After a mistake in the reservation in a nearby hotel, we arrived there by chance at 1 am, and were lucky enough to find that one room was still available. Under such circumstances, we had no great expectations, but soon found that the place was really good. Good taste, clean, competent and friendly staff... Do not miss the little outside yard, which is very tempting -even though there is so much to do in Rome, and so many nice places to seat...

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: Patti P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a lovely street just steps from St. Peter's Square and about an 8 minute walk to the Octaviano metro stop. The hotel staff was wonderful in helping me plan my days, recommending good restaurants, and arranging airport transport. My room was large and very clean and breakfast was delightful. I highly recommend the hotel. The only catch was I had to keep up with some work and the internet is a bit intermittent -- but that's the case just about all over the country.

Reviews.Title: “Vatican Close”
Reviews.Author: Ken R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sant' Anna for two nights at the recommendation of two different friends. We wanted to be within walking distance of the Vatican. This hotel is almost in the Pope's apartment! It is only a block from the Vatican. The hotel, while small, is clean and neat. The rooms are nicely decorated and quaint. Staff is pleasant and courteous. Room rates are reasonable for Rome. It is on a street with numerous restaurants having tables set outside right on the street. For a nice reasonably priced dinner, consider the Tre Pupazzi, about three blocks down at Borgo Pio 183.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in every way!”
Reviews.Author: corydalis
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. Its location is perfect... steps from the Vatican and St. Peter's, on a quiet pedestrian street in an upscale neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated. The walls of our room on the first floor were painted with scenes of Roman gardens, we had a marble bath and private courtyard with its own frescoes. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A delicious breakfast was included in the room rate. We would go back to Rome just to stay at this delightful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: azita a
Reviews.Content: Staff and the hotel location was wonderful. The hotel is near everything . Great value and they even have continental breakfast included. We loved it and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cjc1261
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very lovely with modern conveinences yet it has an old world charm. The staff was accommodating to our every need. It was very clean and is in a great location. I would re-visit this hotel at anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Ymarec
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights. It is very close to the Vatican and St. Peter's Square (3 blocks). Many restaurants right outside its doors. Our favorite was Sora Franco. Their pizza was oh so yummy! There is a great gelato store just 1/2 block down, too. Very friendly employees! The hotel staff was very nice and friendly...always with a smile! The room was clean and comfortable. We had a small patio but didn't use because of mosquitos (my daughter got quite bitten up).The air cond. worked well cooling us down after a long day of walking around Rome. The breakfast room offered cereals, eggs, proscuitto, breads, sausages, pastries, cheeses, juices, coffee and tea. All was tasty :0) The hotel is about 1/2 mile from the Ottoviano Metro stop. This was handy for us to travel around the city by taking the Metro, I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend this hotel if traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat !”
Reviews.Author: Chantman
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel close to the Vatican. We had a generous size room which had been artfully decorated, an excellent bathroom and a small terrace. The front desk personnel were all good. Breakfast was reasonable enough without being exciting. In a nice street. Perhaps a little too close to the Vatican - busloads of tourists roaming the adjacent streets - but otherwise no negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Sant'Anna-- excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chuck4u
Reviews.Content: Sant'Anna is located about 3 blocks from the Vatican-- great location if the Vatican is on your agenda. It's a little further to the other sights of the city (ancient Rome, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps... but walkable-- especially to Campo d'Fiori, Piazza Navona, Pantheon). It's on a street where no car traffic is allowed. Despite this, the street is VERY busy with tourists during the day. However, after about 6 PM everything quiets down & the tourists move on. At night, it is very quiet & great for sleeping. We had 2 rooms-- a triple & a double used as a single. The triple was huge! It had plenty of room for me, my wife & young child. And, the double was spacious as well. The rooms & bathrooms were clean & the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms looked as if they had recently been completely updated, but the bedroom part was a bit older but still looked good. The showers were a little unique. The triple had a tile half wall for entry (no door-- the water sprinkles out on to the floor a bit) & the double had a curtain you draw around you on all sides. They worked well. They had flat screen TVs with satellite & a lot of stations-- none were English-speaking channels. Air conditioning worked just fine-- in fact, it got a little cool at night! Internet is available in the lobby for free (didn't have a laptop, so I don't know about the quality or cost of WIFI-- I think it's free). Breakfast was very good-- they provided it in a nice room in the basement floor. Meats, cheeses, breads, juices, coffee, hot chocolate, fruit, yogurt, scrambled eggs, etc. were available daily. The woman (sorry, forgot her name) who works at the front desk was fabulous. She was very helpful with our questions & requests prior to our arrival & was very nice when we were there. Good service by everyone we dealt with at the front desk. It's always a crapshoot when picking a hotel in a foreign city... again, this is as close to a sure thing as you're going to get in Rome. Clean, comfortable, convenient (esp. to the Vatican) hotel at a reasonable price. Restaurants near the hotel are just okay-- tailored to tourists (okay food at slightly higher prices). Arlu is supposed to be okay but it's only open until 6 PM, so we weren't able to try it. Venture out a few streets to get better food.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: obwan1432
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Italy for the first time. We are a family of 4. This hotel was recommended to us so we already had high expectations. Needless to say, those expectations were well founded and actually were exceeded greatly. We stayed the 1st four nights of our vacation at the Sant' Anna then traveled to Florence for two nights and then returned to the Sant' Anna for the last two nights of our trip. Our rooms (46/48 and 20/21 for the return) were clean, roomy, beautifully decorated. They had a mini refrigerator as well as a safe. The breakfast buffet was perfect. We have stayed at many Bed and Breakfast's and this rivaled the best of them even though they are not advertised as one. The location was great. Borgo Pio is a wonderful little street. There are plenty of restaurants on the street although I would recommend the restaurants to the left of the hotel as you walk out as they were less commercialized. In addition to being 2 blocks from the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica, we were able to walk to many things from the Hotel with no issues. Castle Saint Angelo, the Bridge of Angels, The Spanish Step and the Piazza Navona which had many restaurants as well as shops and of course other attractions. For other attractions, we used the bus system or took a taxi which the staff quickly arranged for us. Speaking of the staff, they were wonderful. Elisabetta, Andrea, Mario were so nice and helpful. They treated us like family. The other staff members that we interacted with were also extremely nice. The breakfast buffet staff were also very friendly and actually seemed to get excited if we asked for a Cappuccino. Again, the breakfast was excellent. Overall, this hotel just set the tone for our vacation which was wonderful. We can't wait to return to Rome and one thing is for sure.....we will be staying at the Hotel Sant' Anna.

Reviews.Title: “Roma and La Dolce Vita .”
Reviews.Author: Augie_Rios
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and comfortable and up to American (US) standards. In our party there were 10 of us using, 2 triples and a quad. We had plenty of room and never felt cramped. The breakfast buffet, which is included was a great way to start the day. Fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, pastries, bread, juice and coffee. Capuccino anyone? Of course, and it was awesome. The hotel staff (front desk, servers, cleaning staff) was friendly and always ready to answer a question or provide a tip. Andrea and Elisabetta at the front desk were exceptional. My better half touched base with them via e-mail prior to our arrival multiple times. Each and every time, they would respond and provide answers and suggestions on what to do and how to do it. Their recommendations for transport btwn airport and hotel were very good and were the most reasonable. Andrea proved to be our trusted "consultant" on site. How to go somewhere, where to go for a "bite", how to move around the city using public transport, he was our "man". Rome was terrific, the stay at the St Anna made it even better. Did I menioned it is less than 2 blocks from the Vatican? What a great location! Also, there are plenty of temptations nearby (less than 2 blocks away as you step out of the hotel) to enjoy the dolce vita; gelatto, pastries, pasta and vino! The only drawback was the elevator. Though there is one, it is very small allowing for only 2 people at the most, in tight quarters. We were on the 3rd floor, but got used to walking up the stairs. For a healthy individual, it isn't too much, but if that isn't the case, make sure you can handle anything above the ground level.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Wellymary
Reviews.Content: If you are on a pilgrimage to Rome and especially to Vatican City this is the hotel for you. I found that priests and nuns are often in residence, making it quite holy, which is what I like. Mass at Saint Anne's, the parish church of Vatican CIty, is daily on the hour from 6 am, if you want to start your pilgrimage properly. The rooms are spacious and everything of highest quality- A/C, bathroom well-appointed, cold drinks in fridge. I got soaked on Easter Sunday and Antonella dried and aired all my clothes. I always find the service excellent and friendly and the breakfast is a feast!!!!! You could last all day on it. I don't know why anyone would fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect image of italy, everything and more”
Reviews.Author: debJackson_nj
Reviews.Content: the location, convinience to the vatican, restaurant selection so numerous, very quaint block with locals mixed in. it was perfect and exceeded my expectations. i would highy recommend . many conviniences close by. it was all i hoped italy would be and more

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: hlehoski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within steps of the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica. On a cute street with many restaurant choices. However, the service was poor overall. We tried numerous times to call room service to place an order and no one would ever answer. The front desk staff was cordial but kept contact and interaction to a minimum. Close to a metro line for subway trips to other parts of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Convenient to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: doofy10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Rome for Christmas and loved our stay at Hotel Sant'anna. The hotel is EXTREMELY convenient to the Vatican - about a block from St. Peter's square. We attended Christmas Eve mass at the Vatican and it was such a relief to walk such a short distance to the hotel when many others had to walk long distances since public transportation was closed. As far as the hotel was concerned, it was really clean and relatively affordable compared to other hotels in the area. Having free WiFi was nice, too, since many European hotels charge for it. Also, there were many restaurants and shops nearby. The staff at the front desk gave good recommendations for places to eat and understood quite a bit of English, which was helpful. The room was very modern and was quiet since it overlooked the courtyard. The bathroom was one of the cleanest we had in Europe. All in all, our stay at Hotel Sant'anna was great and I would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: LadyGermany
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 year old son and I stayed at the Hotel S. Anna over the Christmas Holidays. It was wonderful. The entire staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. The location is so close to everything! Also - the breakfast was fantastic and filled everyone up - so we could head out to explore the glory of Rome. When we return to Rome - there is NO doubt - we will stay at the Hotel S. Anna again, again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaChristine22
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Rome with my mom for a mother/daughter adventure. We stayed at the Hotel Sant'Anna. It was perfect! Charming! The staff - Elisabetta and Andrea - were fabulous. Helpful - friendly - most kind. The hotel has a nice breakfast with fresh pastries and good coffee. It is just 2 short blocks from the Vatican. A couple of blocks to Castel St. Angelo. Close to a ton of restaurants and shops. Open air market down the street. Very affordable beautiful little hotel in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quad Room Full of Italian Elegance”
Reviews.Author: landlockedincol
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Rome before our cruise. We usually don't have all four of us in a single room, so I was hesitant, but we loved the property (and Rome) so much, one room was fine. The location was great, near the Vatican and easy access to the metro. The street was lively and authentic during the day, quiet at night. The property is beautiful, the room big, the bathroom very roomy and modern, the a/c worked great. The Staff is very helpful and the American breakfast very good, but the hours limited, and the ladies running it rather surly. I called the hotel directly and was given a better price than on the website. Free wi-fi, refrigerator, and in our room a balcony too.

Reviews.Title: “Vern Nice Hotel Close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: GhiaDE
Reviews.Content: Staff go out of their way to help you. Within 3 blocks of the Vatican on a "no traffic" street lined with shops and restaurants. We had a nice, large room with a beautiful marble bathroom. Plenty of room and very clean. Buffet breakfast set up on the bottom floor in the mornings very filling and a nice way to start the day. Very relaxing garden courtyard and two public rooms with couches/seating. Staff kept our suitcases after check out so we could enjoy the rest of day sightseeing before we left. Very good experience and would recommend them highly, especially if you are looking for a hotel close to the Vatican area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: First, we took advantage of the hotel's offer to have someone pick us up at the airport. Our driver was waiting for us, was driving a beautiful Mercedes and made our trip very comfortable and easy. Our room was very nice, small balcony overlooking the courtyard. Nice, large bathroom, comfy bed and plenty of room to stow luggage, etc. We traveled with a large group of friends and all of us were very happy with our accommodations, the staff and location. Very close to the vatican and a pretty easy walk across the river to Trevi, etc. Would definitely stay in this hotel again - especially when traveling with a group as we used the seating in the courtyard every evening to share our experiences of the day and drink a little wine. VERY nice!

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Rome, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TDKSCHAFF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome over Thanksgiving vacation to be with our daughter, who is finishing a semester in Rome. We decided to stay at this hotel because of all the positive reviews and the location. Well all the good reviews were right. This is the place to stay. The hotel is on a small side street surrounded by great restaurants and shops. It is next door to the Vatican and close to bus and metro stops. The staff, including the owner's son( I never did get his name) Elizabetta and Andrea couldn't have been nicer. Always a smile, always polite and very knowledgeable. It felt like home. Granted that Fox News was the only English speaking TV channel but there was a lot of sports and dubbed American shows. Hopefully someday we'll be back and I'm sure nothing will have changed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made our stay at Sant'Anna better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: EveMtl1979
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visit the Vatican, so staying at the Sant'anna was a great choice. Just a block away from the Vatican and St.Peter's basilica, you simply cannot beat the location. The hotel is very nice, with an outdoor patio, pleasantly decorated common rooms, and a chandelier at reception. Our room (#15) was huge, easily the largest room we'd had in our entire trip to Italy. With a double bed, there were also two settees that could easily make good beds for a couple traveling with young children. The room was also very clean, and quiet, in spite of the fact that it overlooked the street. The staff, particularly Andrea, were very nice. Andrea, who not only took my reservation but checked us in, remembered that we were there for our honeymoon and congratulated us. He was very accommodating to us. As far as amenities go, the breakfast was very generous, consisting of cereals, yogurt, pastries, eggs, meats etc. The business centre wasn't that great--the internet connection was quite slow--but Andrea was very accommodating and let us use his computer when we needed it. I would recommend Sant'anna to any travelers wishing to be close to the Vatican, and who value tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: starting2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant experience. It is right around the corner from the Vatican, therefore very convienant to that. You must take transportion the the other main sights in Rome, but that was not an issue. I was alittle anxious when we arrived to the hotel, our taxi had to let us out alittle ways down the street, because the street it is on does not allow cars. That however was no problem, and once I entered the hotel my fears were put to rest. The check in and check out were extremely easy, and the staff friendly with excellent English. The room was fairly large for our family of 4, and my kids thought it was great! There was a king bed and then 2 twin beds meeting in a V shape in the end of the room. There was alittle balcony patio with a table and 2 chairs, but the wall around it was too high to offer a view. It was very clean, and nicely decorated. Nice TV (which we only used for weather). Breakfast was pretty good, a few pastries, breads and cold cuts. Coffee was brought with hot milk to make your own cappicino in a way. It was very tasty! The day we checked out, our train did not leave for a few hours, and they were very willing to hold our luggage for us until we needed it. If I go to Rome again I would certainly consider this hotel. The only thing that may convince me to try a different one would be to be in a location closer to the other main sights for a different perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Sant'anna Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: TravelEurope56
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sant'anna was a magnificant and a pleasurable experience. Its quaint style reminded us of staying in a small castle. The rooms are very comfortable and well maintained. Our bathrooms were decorated with marble and tile throughout. Their ample breakfast got us off and running each morning of our 5 day stay. If you are looking to stay near St. Peter's then this is the place to stay. It was a short 5 minute walk from the hotel lobby to St. Peter's. Though we were near St. Peter's getting around Rome wasn't a huge problem with the Metro a 10 minute walk away. There are pleny of shops to pass by and look at while walking to the Metro. One particular place we would stop at was the Castroni for an excellent cappuccino a block or two from the Metro. The locals were constantly in and out and it had all kinds of goodies to think about bringing back home. Mario and his staff were always willing to help and give suggestions. When I return to Rome I'll stay here again even though it isn't in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mary Terese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in St. Peter's on May 11, 2007. We stayed at this lovely little hotel on Borgo Pio because it was close to St. Peter's and close to all the attractions that we wanted to visit. The hotel is quaint, the rooms are nicely decorated and there are many amenities. We had a little balcony which was nice to sit on and relax. The hotel has a great breakfast that you can always count on to be good and excellent variety. There is a small garden where you can sit and relax too. We were treated very kindly by all the staff and everyone helped make our stay and our Wedding beautiful. This was my second time at Sant'anna and I would stay there again and again. We hope to return and would not think of staying anywhere else. Thanks Mario and Andrea! Tom and Mary Ann, Cleveland, Ohio, USA

Reviews.Title: “Sweetest hotel and so close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: LANChicago
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at the Hotel Sant'Anna. We had four in our party and two rooms (two singles and one queen). It's so close to the Vatican, you literally can hear the bells and we could see the top of St. Peter's from our terrace and the little street it's on, Borgo Pio, is pedestrian only during the day and is lined with little trattorias and cafes so there is always something to do. The location is really interesting though because it's so close to the Vatican. There's lots of clergy walking around and we felt really safe. Our room was beyond clean each day too and was very comfortable. The breakfast downstairs each morning was a perfect way to start the day. There's plenty of options and it's very American (cereal, egg, etc). It definitely held us over until a late lunch. The staff was very friendly and helpful with recommending restaurants and directions. Also, some luggage in our party was lost by the airline, and the hotel was more than helpful with calling the airline and retrieving the luggage for us. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Hotel with a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghIreland
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that's near The Vatican this is 'THE' one. This hotel sits in the shadows of Saint Peter's Square. It's so close you can here the bells of St Peters toll. It's a fabulous hotel and from you check in until you leave the staff, service, accommodation, food, location - just everything about this hotel is fantastic. I have stayed here 3 times and I'm going back to Rome in May 2007 for my 4th visit and would not dream of staying anywhere else!!!! Lots of restaurants and cafes outside on the cobbled streets where you can enjoy a lovely meal and a glass of wine. This hotel probably would not suit fthe needs of families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Faggio
Reviews.Content: Plus points: quiet location; clean; friendly, helpful staff; great breakfast (for Italy); Neutral points: Excellent location for St Peters (2mins), Sistine Chapel (5 mins) but it is a good half hour walk to the Forum, Trevi, Spanish steps etc. Ask for a large room. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: phy2202
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a hotel that was near the Vatican and WOW did we find it! The location couldn't have been better - the hotel is charming, the staff attentive, the breakfast was simple but plentiful. There are many restaurants along the road where you can enjoy fabulous food and wine. Sit inside or at a table on the street either way it's wonderful. When we return to Rome we'll be staying at Hotel S. Anna.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Very Best”
Reviews.Author: wilburco
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to describe this extraordinary hotel. The minute you arrive you know it is very special. Our room was unbelieveable; large, quiet, immaculate. The gentlemen at the front desk made you feel special; answering all questions and helping with any request. The obvious concern for your being comfortable was apparent at all times. Would we stay again? I can't wait. We were there 7 nights during very hot weather. This hotel and its staff are an oasis in Rome, in the perfect location for everything a person might want to do. How fortunate we were to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel!”
Reviews.Author: prisam
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly enchanted with this lovely hotel close to the Vatican. The staff arranged for a car to meet us at the airport. The rooms were exceptionally clean. I had a lovely view of a little terrace that I think belonged to a family. My travel companion had a street view and each night we shared a bottle of wine in his room while we listened to the lovely music from the street below. He said that noise was never a problem. We loved the location because it seemed to be a real "neighborhood" , not just a tourist area. The entire staff was absolutely wonderful and very friendly and helpful. It was just a short walk to the metro and we could get anywhere we wanted to go. Breakfast was fine and we were always greeted with a warm smile and buono giorno. It's an absolutely lovely place and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a deal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that Rome is a big city and with a big city comes noise. But I found the hotel not that noisey. Yes.. the rooms aren't amazing but who spends anytime in there room when they have so much to see. The breakfast isn't awful but when in Rome breakfast is a latte and maybe a croissant you get at some little cafe. I never expect free breakfast to be out of this world. The hotel isn't 5 stars but for the price and location it is a deal. I am a VERY picky person and this hotel met my approval. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “MARIO is the MAN!! Great place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob8Portland
Reviews.Content: First off...let me tell you how rare it is to have a hotel guy like Mario in Rome. Long story short...my son and I flew non-stop JFK-Rome Fiumincino..our luggage...was put on Olympic Airlines!!! at JFK!!..(gotta love Alitalia)...ended up in ATHENS!!! We were reunited with our luggage 4 days later thanks to Mario...he totally went to bat for us..a true advocat. We would stay here again no problem. Very nice hotel ...quiet, a\c worked great, on a side street steps away from Vaticano and St. Peter's. Our room number 12 was clean and perfect size for two people. Staff were very nice.. Very good breakfast...plenty to choose from. All and all for the price...around 200 Euro in high season..it was a good choice. RA from USA

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific 3-night stay at this hotel. Traffic-free street with little restaurants up and down the block. The staff was helpful. Breakfast was bountiful. They have a delightful private garden where we had a glass of wine each afternoon before dinner -- a wonderful break from the crowds. Quiet, well-decorated room, and the largest bathroom we experienced in our 2 week trip. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...my new home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSenior
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this great hotel for a week in late March, 2006. I can't think of a single thing to criticize. Search out a discount online, but it's a bargain anyway, given Rome's usual prices and this location. Room 48 was huge, on the street level, but even with the windows open at night, things weren't too noisy. There's individually controlled air conditioning, but at this time of year it wasn't needed. A friend had a room on the 2nd floor that was smaller, but still very comfortable and it looked out on the back patio. The breakfast room was being worked on, so breakfast was served in the room, right on the dot of the time you had requested. Front desk personnel were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Plenty of small restaurants in the neighborhood..as well as shops of many kinds. It is about 5 minutes or less to St. Peter's Square and handy to the lines for the Vatican Museum.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel in a small side street away from the buzzle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1802
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my mother and to be honest I can´t quite share the previous reviews to the full extend. The hotel was indeed clean, nice and my room was large with a balcony. My mothers rooms was very dark and very warm despite the cooler weather in March and despite we opened the window. The breakfast was served in the room (the breakfast room was closed) and it was an ordinary breakfast, nothing special, but o.k, however, the room condition didn´t allow us to really sit down comfortably and have a nice breakfast together, because the tables were very small and we both faced the wall in opposite corners. There was only one tray and hardly any plates, so I felt more like camping during breakfast. I would have loved to have breakfast in nicer surrondings. The breakfast was served exactly on time. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The last night in the 1st floor was very noisy and my mum couldn´t go to sleep before 1 a.m. I didn´t face this problem. The location is excellant and so near to St. Peters and Vatican City. The street Borgo Pio is very quiet with lots of restaurants and souvenir shops around. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying in a so called 4 star hotel near the Termini this gorgeous little hotel was a breath of fresh air, perfect location if you need to be near the Vatican. Our room wasn't huge but was mirriored floor to ceiling (!) so you didn't notice the size! The whole place is so charming, boutique-y and sweet it's ridiculous, I would certainly recommend this for couples. Mini bar was a bit sparce, the bathroom was huge, all marble with a seperate walk in shower, satelite TV was great and staff on reception were so helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Oh So Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel S. Anna on our first trip to Italy. Very conveniently located near the Vatican. The staff was courteous, the hotel very clean and lovely. And there was a lovely little restaurant a few doors away where we enjoyed dining outside in the evening and the waiter was terrific, and the food was out of this world. We would definitely recommend this hotel. PS it was VERY hot in June and the air conditioned hotel was a welcomed relief.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros Excellent hotel, friendly staff, wonderful location 3 blocks from vatican and great air conditioning. From here you can walk to Pantheon, Spanish steps, Trevi, forum colleseum and vatican in 1 day. Cons Breakfast was average, but adaquate. Ice was at a premium. Several resteraunts on the street immediately in front of hotel are OK, but waiters are either pushy or non-existant. Hints for Rome Buy 2 litre cokes at grocery store they are half the price of 12 oz soft drinks in resteraunts. For americans drinking a lot of soda, this can be a significant cost savings. Vatican museum line is extremely long in morning, but moves amazingly fast. 3 block line took less than 20 minutes. Watch out for scooters!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased beyond expectations-Sant'anna”
Reviews.Author: Meadow VW
Reviews.Content: We had searched with our travel agent for a hotel that had character and was located close to the Vatican. We found great pleasure in the Sant'anna hotel accommodations, furnishings, hotel staff and location. Built with century old solid walls, our street side, top floor room was very quiet, the balcony very private and the room decorative style well balanced with the ambiance of the hotel. We wanted to be able to see the outdoors at night and to enjoy some wine and cheese at our leisure. Our room met all the requirements exceedingly well. The room was spotlessly cleaned, and the bath was top of the line. The air conditioning was excellent. The hotel had several public areas that were fun to be in and to meet other hotel guests. There is a hidden garden in the hotel center as well as a breakfast room on the ground level. The arched ceilings and art work was pleasing to observe. The breakfasts were outstanding and the staff was very attendant. We stayed for 4 days and will return to this very pleasant hotel. If you want easy access to the Vatican or its extensive museums, this is the place to be. When lines were long to see the museum, we could chill out at the hotel until the crowds diminished. We highly recommend Sant'anna Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Location for a Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mabards
Reviews.Content: Hotel S. Anna is a small, friendly, extremely clean and comfortable hotel literally just around the corner from St. Peter's. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. At the last minute they were able to help get us on a tour in the afternoon, and offered great recommendations of places to eat and where to buy wine nearby to take home. Our room had a very small balcony off of it, but for our last night in Rome, after taking our last walk through St. Peter's Square, it was delightful to sit out on our little balcony enjoying the pleasant summer evening. There is also a courtyard to enjoy at the hotel with tables and umbrellas. I would not consider staying someplace else when returning to Rome. If you are heading to Florence or Paris from Rome and like Hotel S. Anna, you may want to consider looking at Hotel Casci in Florence or Residence Foch in Paris. All three of these hotels were similiar in their small at home feeling with the staff fluent in English and eager to help to make your stay in their city an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us, as we were in town for only 3 days. We appreciated being able to walk over to the Vatican area early in the morning and easily back to to hotel to cool off in the heat of the day. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful with all kinds of travel information and dining suggestions. There were 3 couples in our group and we were all very pleased with our rooms and the hotel in general. It's a really nice little oasis amid the crowds and busy streets of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Simma14
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a short break in Rome and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.Excellent decor and furnishings,quiet location and an ample breakfast to start your sightseeing !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: buoybell
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed 4 nights at the hotel S. Anna. The staff were very friendly, and when we checked in were asked if we would like a larger room than we booked, at no extra cost. During our stay the staff allowed us to use their computer to check our e-mail at home. The neighborhood is fun, losts of small shops, a bakery, fruit store, wine shop and many small eateries. It really is a block from St. Peters, and is close to the metro and a major bus and trolly stop. It is also a short walk across the bridges to other major tourist attractions and great neighborhoods. We would stay again when going back to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: historybuff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sant'Anna and loved it!!!! Five minutes from Saint Peter's. Clean. Good breakfasts. Pleasant staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sant Anna Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Borgo Pio 134, 00193 Rome, Italy
